text:
Is there a bug with type stability and splatting? For example,
```@code_warntype vcat([rand(Float32, 5) for i in 1:3]...)```
is not type stable.

elements.text: Is there a bug with type stability and splatting? For example,

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>
Not a bug, it's just that the length of an array (and therefore the number of elements of the splat) is not known at compile time

elements.text: Not a bug, it's just that the length of an array (and therefore the number of elements of the splat) is not known at compile time

text: If you splat e.g. a Tuple, it's no problem

elements.text: If you splat e.g. a Tuple, it's no problem

text: You mean like `@code_warntype vcat((rand(Float32, 5) for i in 1:2)...)`?
because that would also be type unstable

elements.text: because that would also be type unstable

text:
Nope, the range also does not carry its length as a type param.
But something like vcat(ntuple (i -> rand(Float32, 5), 2)...) should be

elements.text:
Nope, the range also does not carry its length as a type param.
But something like vcat(ntuple (i -> rand(Float32, 5), 2)...) should be
